pros: I joined planning for research and higher studies. I was able to choose a research topic of interest and build on it. The experience provided me an outstanding profile. The  mentoring helped me get admission to global top 10 ranking university abroad with full scholarship. The institution changed my life without it I would not have achieved so much.
cons: I don't have any cons to write.  How can  there be  any cons when I received Rs 4 million scholarship!

pros: Focus is on action research.  Identifying problems in society and developing solutions. Implementing technology and community based programmes to address problems of food, water, rural communities, healthcare, etc.  I feel I was able to make real difference in life of my project beneficiaries.
cons: Hardworking and serious people.  Fieldwork and lots of commitment is required in effectively doing projects from scratch.

pros: One will get to know about further studies options and scholarships available
cons:
Got hired as trainee engineer and ended up working without any pay. Should pay a percentage of scholarship amount availed to the organisation as a premium. 
Should be ready to work without any pay

pros: Executes interdisciplinary projects by collaborating with resources at research organizations,  institutions and companies.  This makes it inclusive and efficient.  I worked jointly with CSIR-CFTRI to develop and commercialize food technology.
Training and development opportunities are excellent. Through career support received fully funded scholarship covering full fees and living expenses to study and pursue further research in the UK.
cons: There are no cons at all

pros: A social organisation located in a beautiful city - Alleppey. Cost of living is low.
cons: There are no downsides. Modest campus.
